medra_code.Grade 1: Hemoglobin (Hgb) <LLN - 10.0 g/dL; <LLN - 6.2 mmol/L; <LLN - 100 g/L
medra_code.Grade 3: Hgb <8.0 g/dL; <4.9 mmol/L; <80 g/L; transfusion indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a reduction in the amount of hemoglobin in 100 ml of blood. Signs and symptoms of anemia may include pallor of the skin and mucous membranes, shortness of breath, palpitations of the heart, soft systolic murmurs, lethargy, and fatigability.

medra_code.CTCAE Term: Blood and lymphatic system disorders - Other, specify
medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

medra_code.Grade 1: Mildly hypocellular or <=25% reduction from normal cellularity for age
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderately hypocellular or >25 - <50% reduction from normal cellularity for age
medra_code.Grade 3: Severely hypocellular or >50 - <=75% reduction cellularity from normal for age
medra_code.Grade 4: Aplastic persistent for longer than 2 weeks
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the bone marrow to produce hematopoietic elements.

medra_code.Grade 2: Laboratory findings with no bleeding
medra_code.Grade 3: Laboratory findings and bleeding
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by systemic pathological activation of blood clotting mechanisms which results in clot formation throughout the body. There is an increase in the risk of hemorrhage as the body is depleted of platelets and coagulation factors.

medra_code.Grade 1: >ULN and >Baseline
medra_code.Grade 3: Steroids initiated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an increased number of eosinophils in the blood.

medra_code.Grade 3: ANC <1000/mm3 with a single temperature of >38.3 degrees C (101 degrees F) or a sustained temperature of >=38 degrees C (100.4 degrees F) for more than one hour
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an ANC <1000/mm3 and a single temperature of >38.3 degrees C (101 degrees F) or a sustained temperature of >=38 degrees C (100.4 degrees F) for more than one hour

medra_code.Grade 1: Laboratory evidence of hemolysis only (e.g., direct antiglobulin test; DAT; Coombs'; schistocytes; decreased haptoglobin)
medra_code.Grade 2: Evidence of hemolysis and >=2 g decrease in hemoglobin
medra_code.Grade 3: Transfusion or medical intervention indicated (e.g., steroids)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate widespread erythrocyte cell membrane destruction.

medra_code.Grade 3: Laboratory findings with clinical consequences (e.g., renal insufficiency, petechiae)
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences, (e.g., CNS hemorrhage or thrombosis/embolism or renal failure)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a form of thrombotic microangiopathy with renal failure, hemolytic anemia, and severe thrombocytopenia.

medra_code.Grade 4: Clinical manifestations of leucostasis; urgent intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate an increased number of white blood cells in the blood.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in a lymph node.

medra_code.Grade 2: >ULN
medra_code.Grade 3: Requiring urgent intervention
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate increased methemoglobin in the blood.

medra_code.Grade 3: Laboratory findings with clinical consequences (e.g., renal insufficiency, petechiae)
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences, (e.g., CNS hemorrhage or thrombosis/embolism or renal failure)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenic purpura, fever, renal abnormalities and neurological abnormalities such as seizures, hemiplegia, and visual disturbances. It is an acute or subacute condition.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
medra_code.Grade 2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in aortic valve function or structure.

medra_code.Grade 1: Periods of asystole; non-urgent medical management indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without cardiac electrical activity. Typically, this is accompanied by cessation of the pumping function of the heart.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker); ablation; new onset
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; embolus requiring urgent intervention
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without discernible P waves and an irregular ventricular response due to multiple reentry circuits. The rhythm disturbance originates above the ventricles.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; device (e.g., pacemaker); ablation
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; embolus requiring urgent intervention
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with organized rhythmic atrial contractions with a rate of 200-300 beats per minute. The rhythm disturbance originates in the atria.

medra_code.Grade 2: Non-urgent intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker); new onset
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with complete failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the AV node to the ventricles.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Non-urgent intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a delay in the time required for the conduction of an electrical impulse through the atrioventricular (AV) node beyond 0.2 seconds; prolongation of the PR interval greater than 200 milliseconds.
A disorder characterized by cessation of the pumping function of the heart.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; pain on exertion; limiting instrumental ADL; hemodynamically stable
medra_code.Grade 3: Pain at rest; limiting self care ADL; cardiac catheterization; new onset cardiac chest pain; unstable angina
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by substernal discomfort due to insufficient myocardial oxygenation e.g., angina pectoris.
medra_code.Navigational Note: Also consider Cardiac disorders: Myocardial infarction.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by pathological irregularities in the cardiac conduction system.

medra_code.Grade 2: Present
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a bluish discoloration of the skin and/or mucous membranes.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic with laboratory (e.g., BNP [B-Natriuretic Peptide ]) or cardiac imaging abnormalities
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptoms at rest or with minimal activity or exertion; hospitalization; new onset of symptoms
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., continuous IV therapy or mechanical hemodynamic support)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the inability of the heart to pump blood at an adequate volume to meet tissue metabolic requirements, or, the ability to do so only at an elevation in the filling pressure.
medra_code.Navigational Note: If left sided use Cardiac disorders: Left ventricular systolic dysfunction; also consider Cardiac disorders: Restrictive cardiomyopathy, Investigations: Ejection fraction decreased.

medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic due to drop in ejection fraction responsive to intervention
medra_code.Grade 4: Refractory or poorly controlled heart failure due to drop in ejection fraction; intervention such as ventricular assist device, intravenous vasopressor support, or heart transplant indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by failure of the left ventricle to produce adequate output.
medra_code.Navigational Note: Also consider Investigations: Ejection fraction decreased.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
medra_code.Grade 2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in mitral valve function or structure.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker); new onset
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with relatively constant PR interval prior to the block of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic and incompletely controlled medically, or controlled with device (e.g., pacemaker)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a progressively lengthening PR interval prior to the blocking of an atrial impulse. This is the result of intermittent failure of atrial electrical impulse conduction through the atrioventricular (AV) node to the ventricles.

medra_code.Grade 2: Asymptomatic and cardiac enzymes minimally abnormal and no evidence of ischemic ECG changes
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; cardiac enzymes abnormal; hemodynamically stable; ECG changes consistent with infarction
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by gross necrosis of the myocardium; this is due to an interruption of blood supply to the area.

medra_code.Grade 2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe with symptoms at rest or with minimal activity or exertion; intervention indicated; new onset of symptoms
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., continuous IV therapy or mechanical hemodynamic support)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the muscle tissue of the heart.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an unpleasant sensation of irregular and/or forceful beating of the heart.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated; ablation
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; incompletely controlled medically; cardioversion indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with abrupt onset and sudden termination of atrial contractions with a rate of 150-250 beats per minute. The rhythm disturbance originates in the atria.

medra_code.Grade 2: Asymptomatic effusion size small to moderate
medra_code.Grade 3: Effusion with physiologic consequences
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.
A disorder characterized by an increase in intrapericardial pressure due to the collection of blood or fluid in the pericardium.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, ECG or physical findings (e.g., rub) consistent with pericarditis
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic pericarditis (e.g., chest pain)
medra_code.Grade 3: Pericarditis with physiologic consequences (e.g., pericardial constriction)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by irritation to the layers of the pericardium (the protective sac around the heart).

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
medra_code.Grade 2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis by imaging; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in pulmonary valve function or structure.

medra_code.Grade 1: Imaging findings only
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic without signs of heart failure
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic heart failure or other cardiac symptoms, responsive to intervention; new onset of symptoms
medra_code.Grade 4: Refractory heart failure or other poorly controlled cardiac symptoms
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an inability of the ventricles to fill with blood because the myocardium (heart muscle) stiffens and loses its flexibility.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic with laboratory (e.g., BNP [B-Natriuretic Peptide ]) or cardiac imaging abnormalities
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptoms with moderate activity or exertion
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms, associated with hypoxia, right heart failure; oxygen indicated
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., ventricular assist device); heart transplant indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by impairment of right ventricular function associated with low ejection fraction and a decrease in motility of the right ventricular wall.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic, intervention not indicated; change in medication initiated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic, intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with alternating periods of bradycardia and atrial tachycardia accompanied by syncope, fatigue and dizziness.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic, intervention not indicated; change in medication initiated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic, intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate less than 60 beats per minute that originates in the sinus node.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; non-urgent medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Urgent medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates in the sinus node.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates above the ventricles.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic valvular thickening with or without mild valvular regurgitation or stenosis
medra_code.Grade 2: Asymptomatic; moderate regurgitation or stenosis by imaging
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic; severe regurgitation or stenosis; symptoms controlled with medical intervention
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated (e.g., valve replacement, valvuloplasty)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a defect in tricuspid valve function or structure.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic, intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Urgent intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia that originates in the ventricles.
A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia without discernible QRS complexes due to rapid repetitive excitation of myocardial fibers without coordinated contraction of the ventricles.

medra_code.Grade 2: Non-urgent medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a dysrhythmia with a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute that originates distal to the bundle of His.

medra_code.CTCAE Term: Congenital, familial and genetic disorders - Other, specify
medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

medra_code.CTCAE Term: Ear and labyrinth disorders - Other, specify
medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the ear.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the external ear region.

medra_code.Grade 4:
Adults: Decrease in hearing to profound bilateral loss (absolute threshold >80 dB HL at 2 kHz and above); nonservicable hearing

Pediatric: Audiologic indication for cochlear implant; > 40 dB HL (i.e., 45 dB HL or more); SNHL at 2 kHz and above
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by partial or complete loss of the ability to detect or understand sounds resulting from damage to ear structures.

medra_code.Grade 1: Serous otitis
medra_code.Grade 2: Serous otitis, medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Mastoiditis; necrosis of canal soft tissue or bone
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation (physiologic response to irritation), swelling and redness to the middle ear.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by noise in the ears, such as ringing, buzzing, roaring or clicking.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation as if the external world were revolving around the patient (objective vertigo) or as if he himself were revolving in space (subjective vertigo).

medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by dizziness, imbalance, nausea, and vision problems.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the adrenal cortex not producing enough of the hormone cortisol and in some cases, the hormone aldosterone. It may be due to a disorder of the adrenal cortex as in Addison's disease or primary adrenal insufficiency.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms, medical intervention or hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by signs and symptoms that resemble Cushing's disease or syndrome: buffalo hump obesity, striations, adiposity, hypertension, diabetes, and osteoporosis, usually due to exogenous corticosteroids.

medra_code.Grade 2: No breast development by age 13 yrs for females; testes volume of <3 cc or no Tanner Stage 2 development by age 14.5 yrs for males
medra_code.Grade 3: No breast development by age 14 yrs for females; no increase in testes volume or no Tanner Stage 2 by age 16 yrs for males; hormone replacement indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by unusually late sexual maturity.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

medra_code.Grade 2: >= +2 SD (standard deviation) above mid parental height or target height
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by greater growth than expected for age.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in production of parathyroid hormone by the parathyroid glands. This results in hypercalcemia (abnormally high levels of calcium in the blood).

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; thyroid suppression therapy indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by excessive levels of thyroid hormone in the body. Common causes include an overactive thyroid gland or thyroid hormone overdose.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; medical intervention or hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of parathyroid hormone by the parathyroid glands.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation and cellular infiltration of the pituitary gland.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of hormones from the pituitary gland.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; thyroid replacement indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in production of thyroid hormone by the thyroid gland.

medra_code.Grade 1: Physical signs of puberty with no biochemical markers for females <8 years and males <9 years
medra_code.Grade 2: Physical signs and biochemical markers of puberty for females <8 years and males <9 years
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by unusually early development of secondary sexual features; the onset of sexual maturation begins usually before age 8 for girls and before age 9 for boys.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; mild symptoms with no intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Replacement therapy initiated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by low testosterone.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by inappropriate masculinization occurring in a female or prepubertal male.

medra_code.Grade 1: Intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Grade 4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by visual perception of unclear or fuzzy images.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); glare symptoms affecting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Grade 4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by partial or complete opacity of the crystalline lens of one or both eyes. This results in a decrease in visual acuity and eventual blindness if untreated.

medra_code.Grade 3: Corneal ulcer without perforation in the affected eye
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an area of epithelial tissue loss on the surface of the cornea. It is associated with inflammatory cells in the cornea and anterior chamber.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; symptoms relieved by lubricants
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by dryness of the cornea and conjunctiva.
medra_code.Navigational Note: If corneal ulcer is present, grade under Eye disorders: Corneal ulcer.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
medra_code.Grade 2: Unilateral paresis without double vision
medra_code.Grade 3: Bilateral paresis or unilateral paresis causing double vision in peripheral gaze, but not in central gaze
medra_code.Grade 4: Bilateral paresis requiring head turning to see beyond central 60 degrees or double vision in central gaze
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by incomplete paralysis of an extraocular muscle.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated; no change in vision
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL; best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately sight-threatening; limiting self care ADL; decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200)
medra_code.Grade 4: Sight-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated; best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the eye.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; nonoperative intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Limiting self care ADL; operative intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by impaired eyelid function.

medra_code.Grade 1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
medra_code.Grade 2: Limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden or brief burst of light.
medra_code.Navigational Note: Also consider Eye disorders: Retinal tear or Retinal detachment

medra_code.Grade 1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
medra_code.Grade 2: Limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an individual seeing spots before their eyes. The spots are shadows of opaque cell fragments in the vitreous humor or lens.
medra_code.Navigational Note: Also consider Eye disorders: Retinal tear or Retinal detachment

medra_code.Grade 1: Less than 8 mmHg of elevated intraocular pressure (EIOP); no visual field deficit
medra_code.Grade 2: EIOP which can be reduced to 21 mmHg or under with topical medications and no visual field deficit
medra_code.Grade 3: EIOP causing visual field deficits
medra_code.Grade 4: Visual field deficit within the central 10 degrees of the visual field in the affected eye
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in pressure in the eyeball due to obstruction of the aqueous humor outflow.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); corneal ulcer; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Grade 4: Perforation; best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation to the cornea of the eye.
medra_code.Navigational Note: Also consider Eye disorders: Corneal ulcer

medra_code.Grade 1: Symptomatic but not limiting ADL
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline); limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic with marked decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity worse than 20/40 or more than 3 lines of decreased vision from known baseline, up to 20/200); limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Grade 4: Best corrected visual acuity of 20/200 or worse in the affected eye
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an inability to see clearly in dim light.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate decrease in visual acuity (best corrected visual acuity 20/40 and better or 3 lines or less decreased vision from known baseline)

medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by excessive fluid in a joint, usually as a result of joint inflammation.

medra_code.Grade 1: <=25% loss of ROM (range of motion); decreased ROM limiting athletic activity
medra_code.Grade 2: >25 - 50% decrease in ROM; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: >50% decrease in ROM; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in joint flexibility of any joint.

medra_code.CTCAE Term: Joint range of motion decreased cervical spine
medra_code.Grade 1: Mild restriction of rotation or flexion between 60 - 70 degrees
medra_code.Grade 2: Rotation <60 degrees to right or left; <60 degrees of flexion
medra_code.Grade 3: Ankylosed/fused over multiple segments with no C-spine rotation
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in flexibility of a cervical spine joint.

medra_code.CTCAE Term: Joint range of motion decreased lumbar spine
medra_code.Grade 1: Stiffness; difficulty bending to the floor to pick up a very light object but able to do athletic activity
medra_code.Grade 2: Pain with range of motion (ROM) in lumbar spine; requires a reaching aid to pick up a very light object from the floor
medra_code.Grade 3: <50% lumbar spine flexion; associated with symptoms of ankylosis or fused over multiple segments with no L-spine flexion (e.g., unable to reach to floor to pick up a very light object)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in flexibility of a lumbar spine joint.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate accentuation; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe accentuation; operative intervention indicated; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal increase in the curvature of the thoracic portion of the spine.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate accentuation; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe accentuation; operative intervention indicated; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal increase in the curvature of the lumbar portion of the spine.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by marked cramping sensation originating from a muscle or group of muscles.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; medical intervention indicated (e.g., analgesics or bisphosphonates); limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; elective operative intervention indicated

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated

medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; elective operative intervention indicated

medra_code.Grade 1:
Adult: Radiologic evidence of osteoporosis or Bone Mineral Density (BMD) t-score -1 to -2.5 (osteopenia); 

Pediatric: Radiologic evidence of low BMD with z score of <= -2.0 and no history of significant fractures
medra_code.Grade 2:
Adult: BMD t-score < -2.5; loss of height <2 cm; therapy to improve BMD indicated; limiting instrumental ADL;

Pediatric: Low BMD (z-score <= -2.0) and significant fracture history (defined as a long bone fracture of the lower extremity, vertebral compression, 2 or more long bone fractures of the upper extremities); therapy to improve BMD indicated
medra_code.Grade 3:
Adult: Loss of height >=2 cm; hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL; 

Pediatric: Limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by reduced bone mass, with a decrease in cortical thickness and in the number and size of the trabeculae of cancellous bone (but normal chemical composition), resulting in increased fracture incidence.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL

medra_code.Grade 3: Operative debridement or other invasive intervention indicated (e.g., tissue reconstruction, flap, or grafting)

medra_code.Grade 2: Non-urgent intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Symptomatic, urgent intervention indicated

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated

medra_code.Grade 2: >20 - 45 degrees; visible by forward flexion; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: >45 degrees; scapular prominence in forward flexion; operative intervention indicated; limiting self care ADL

medra_code.Grade 3: Operative debridement or other invasive intervention indicated (e.g., tissue reconstruction, flap, or grafting)

medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by dysfunction of the corticospinal (pyramidal) tracts of the spinal cord. Symptoms include an increase in the muscle tone in the lower extremities, hyperreflexia, positive Babinski and a decrease in fine motor coordination.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation involving a nerve root. Patients experience marked discomfort radiating along a nerve path because of spinal pressure on the connecting nerve root.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; medical intervention indicated (e.g., thyroplasty, vocal cord injection)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by paralysis of the recurrent laryngeal nerve.

medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by headaches, mental status changes, visual disturbances, and/or seizures associated with imaging findings of posterior leukoencephalopathy. It has been observed in association with hypertensive encephalopathy, eclampsia, and immunosuppressive and cytotoxic drug treatment. It is an acute or subacute reversible condition. Also known as posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome (PRES).

medra_code.Grade 1: Brief partial seizure and no loss of consciousness
medra_code.Grade 2: Brief generalized seizure
medra_code.Grade 3: New onset seizures (partial or generalized); multiple seizures despite medical intervention
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild but more than usual drowsiness or sleepiness
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate sedation; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Obtundation or stupor
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by characterized by excessive sleepiness and drowsiness.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild or slight increase in muscle tone
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate increase in muscle tone and increase in resistance through range of motion
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe increase in muscle tone and increase in resistance through range of motion
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; unable to move active or passive range of motion
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by increased involuntary muscle tone that affects the regions interfering with voluntary movement. It results in gait, movement, and speech disturbances.

medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by pressure on the spinal cord.

medra_code.Grade 1: Incidental radiographic findings only
medra_code.Grade 2: Mild to moderate neurologic deficit; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe neurologic deficit; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease or absence of blood supply to the brain caused by obstruction (thrombosis or embolism) of an artery resulting in neurological damage.

medra_code.Grade 3: Fainting; orthostatic collapse
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by spontaneous loss of consciousness caused by insufficient blood supply to the brain.

medra_code.Grade 1: Ankle reflex reduced
medra_code.Grade 2: Ankle reflex absent; other reflexes reduced
medra_code.Grade 3: Absence of all reflexes
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by less than normal deep tendon reflexes.
medra_code.Navigational Note: Also consider Nervous system disorders: Peripheral motor neuropathy or Peripheral sensory neuropathy

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild neurologic deficit with or without imaging confirmation
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate neurologic deficit with or without imaging confirmation
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a brief attack (less than 24 hours) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit.
medra_code.Navigational Note: If >24 hours, Consider Nervous system disorders: Stroke

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the uncontrolled shaking movement of the whole body or individual parts.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by dysfunction of the trigeminal nerve (fifth cranial nerve).

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by dysfunction of the trochlear nerve (fourth cranial nerve).

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by dysfunction of the vagus nerve (tenth cranial nerve).

medra_code.Grade 3: Present
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden drop of the blood pressure, bradycardia, and peripheral vasodilation that may lead to loss of consciousness. It results from an increase in the stimulation of the vagus nerve.

medra_code.Grade 2: <10% percentile of weight for gestational age
medra_code.Grade 3: <5% percentile of weight for gestational age
medra_code.Grade 4: <1% percentile of weight for gestational age
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by inhibition of fetal growth resulting in the inability of the fetus to achieve its potential weight.

medra_code.Grade 4: Fetal loss at any gestational age
medra_code.Definition: Death in utero.

medra_code.CTCAE Term: Pregnancy, puerperium and perinatal conditions - Other, specify
medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

medra_code.Grade 1: Delivery of a liveborn infant at >34 to 37 weeks gestation
medra_code.Grade 2: Delivery of a liveborn infant at >28 to 34 weeks gestation
medra_code.Grade 3: Delivery of a liveborn infant at 24 to 28 weeks gestation
medra_code.Grade 4: Delivery of a liveborn infant at 24 weeks of gestation or less
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by delivery of a viable infant before the normal end of gestation. Typically, viability is achievable between the twentieth and thirty-seventh week of gestation.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild mood alteration
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate mood alteration
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe agitation; hospitalization not indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a state of restlessness associated with unpleasant feelings of irritability and tension.

medra_code.Grade 1: Inability to achieve orgasm not adversely affecting relationship
medra_code.Grade 2: Inability to achieve orgasm adversely affecting relationship
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an inability to achieve orgasm.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by apprehension of danger and dread accompanied by restlessness, tension, tachycardia, and dyspnea unattached to a clearly identifiable stimulus.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild disorientation
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate disorientation; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe disorientation; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a lack of clear and orderly thought and behavior.

medra_code.Grade 1: Delay in achieving orgasm not adversely affecting relationship
medra_code.Grade 2: Delay in achieving orgasm adversely affecting relationship
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by sexual dysfunction characterized by a delay in climax.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild acute confusional state
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate and acute confusional state; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe and acute confusional state; limiting self care ADL; urgent intervention indicated; new onset
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; urgent intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the acute and sudden development of confusion, illusions, movement changes, inattentiveness, agitation, and hallucinations. Usually, it is a reversible condition.

medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate delusional symptoms
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe delusional symptoms; hospitalization not indicated; new onset
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by false personal beliefs held contrary to reality, despite contradictory evidence and common sense.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild depressive symptoms
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate depressive symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe depressive symptoms; limiting self care ADL; hospitalization not indicated
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by melancholic feelings of grief or unhappiness.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild mood elevation
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate mood elevation
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe mood elevation (e.g., hypomania)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an exaggerated feeling of well-being which is disproportionate to events and stimuli.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild hallucinations (e.g., perceptual distortions)
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate hallucinations
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe hallucinations; hospitalization not indicated
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a false sensory perception in the absence of an external stimulus.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep or waking up early
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep or waking up early
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe difficulty in falling asleep, staying asleep or waking up early
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by difficulty in falling asleep and/or remaining asleep.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild; easily consolable
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; limiting instrumental ADL; increased attention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe abnormal or excessive response; limiting self care ADL; inconsolable; medical or psychiatric intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal responsiveness to stimuli or physiological arousal; may be in response to pain, fright, a drug, an emotional situation or a medical condition.

medra_code.Grade 1: Decrease in sexual interest not adversely affecting relationship
medra_code.Grade 2: Decrease in sexual interest adversely affecting relationship
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a decrease in sexual desire.

medra_code.Grade 1: Present
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an increase in sexual desire.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild manic symptoms (e.g., elevated mood, rapid thoughts, rapid speech, decreased need for sleep)
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate manic symptoms (e.g., relationship and work difficulties; poor hygiene)
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe manic symptoms (e.g., hypomania; major sexual or financial indiscretions); hospitalization not indicated; new onset
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by excitement of psychotic proportions manifested by mental and physical hyperactivity, disorganization of behavior and elevation of mood.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild personality change
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate personality change
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe personality change; hospitalization not indicated
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a conspicuous change in a person's behavior and thinking.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; hospitalization or urgent intervention indicated

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild psychotic symptoms
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate psychotic symptoms (e.g., disorganized speech; impaired reality testing)
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe psychotic symptoms (e.g., paranoid, extreme disorganization); hospitalization not indicated; new onset
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences, threats of harm to self or others; hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by personality change, impaired functioning, and loss of touch with reality. It may be a manifestation of schizophrenia, bipolar disorder or brain tumor.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an inability to rest, relax or be still.

medra_code.Grade 1: Increased thoughts of death but no wish to kill oneself
medra_code.Grade 2: Suicidal ideation with no specific plan or intent
medra_code.Grade 3: Specific plan to commit suicide without serious intent to die which may not require hospitalization
medra_code.Grade 4: Specific plan to commit suicide with serious intent to die which requires hospitalization
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by thoughts of taking one's own life.

medra_code.Grade 3: Suicide attempt or gesture without intent to die
medra_code.Grade 4: Suicide attempt with intent to die which requires hospitalization
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by self-inflicted harm in an attempt to end one's own life.

medra_code.Grade 3: Hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the acute loss of renal function (within 2 weeks) and is traditionally classified as pre-renal (low blood flow into kidney), renal (kidney damage) and post-renal causes (ureteral or bladder outflow obstruction).
medra_code.Navigational Note: Also consider Investigations: Creatinine increased

medra_code.Grade 2: Invasive intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; organ failure; urgent operative intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a rupture in the bladder wall.

medra_code.Grade 1: Intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Antispasmodics indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Hospitalization indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden and involuntary contraction of the bladder wall.

medra_code.Grade 1: eGFR (estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate) or CrCl (creatinine clearance) <LLN - 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 or proteinuria 2+ present; urine protein/creatinine >0.5
medra_code.Grade 2: eGFR or CrCl 59 - 30 ml/min/1.73 m2
medra_code.Grade 3: eGFR or CrCl 29 - 15 ml/min/1.73 m2
medra_code.Grade 4: eGFR or CrCl <15 ml/min/1.73 m2; dialysis or renal transplant indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by gradual and usually permanent loss of kidney function resulting in renal failure.

medra_code.Grade 1: Microscopic hematuria; minimal increase in frequency, urgency, dysuria, or nocturia; new onset of incontinence
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate hematuria; moderate increase in frequency, urgency, dysuria, nocturia or incontinence; urinary catheter placement or bladder irrigation indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Gross hematuria; transfusion, IV medications, or hospitalization indicated; elective invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the bladder which is not caused by an infection of the urinary tract.

medra_code.Grade 1: Present
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by painful urination.
medra_code.Navigational Note: If associated with an infection, report the infection. For grades higher than Grade 1, consider Renal and urinary disorders: Bladder spasm or Cystitis noninfective; Infections and infestations: Urinary tract infection.

medra_code.Grade 1: Present
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate glucose in the urine.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; urinary catheter or bladder irrigation indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Gross hematuria; transfusion, IV medications, or hospitalization indicated; elective invasive intervention indicated; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate blood in the urine.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate the presence of free hemoglobin in the urine.
medra_code.Navigational Note: Report underlying AE if > Grade 1

medra_code.Grade 3: Not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by symptoms that include severe edema, proteinuria, and hypoalbuminemia; it is indicative of renal dysfunction.

medra_code.Grade 1: 1+ proteinuria; urinary protein ≥ULN - <1.0 g/24 hrs
medra_code.Grade 2:
Adult: 2+ and 3+ proteinuria; urinary protein 1.0 - <3.5 g/24 hrs; 

Pediatric: Urine P/C (Protein/Creatinine) ratio 0.5 - 1.9
medra_code.Grade 3:
Adult: Urinary protein >=3.5 g/24 hrs; 4+ proteinuria;

Pediatric: Urine P/C (Protein/Creatinine) ratio >1.9
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate the presence of excessive protein in the urine. It is predominantly albumin, but also globulin.
medra_code.Navigational Note: 24-hour urine collection takes precedence over dipstick

medra_code.CTCAE Term: Renal and urinary disorders - Other, specify
medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate; minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe or medically significant but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic or mild symptoms; occasional use of nonprescription analgesics indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; oral antiemetics indicated; around the clock nonprescription analgesics or any oral narcotic analgesics indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Hospitalization indicated; IV intervention (e.g., analgesics, antiemetics); elective invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the formation of crystals/kidney stones in the pelvis of the kidney.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain not interfering with activity; nonprescription medication indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL; prescription medication indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Hospitalization indicated; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by paroxysmal and severe flank marked discomfort radiating to the inguinal area. Often, the cause is the passage of crystals/kidney stones.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Analgesics and hematocrit monitoring indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Transfusion indicated; invasive intervention indicated; hospitalization
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the kidney.

medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic, invasive intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by an abnormal communication between any part of the urinary system and another organ or anatomic site.

medra_code.Grade 1: Present
medra_code.Grade 2: Limiting instrumental ADL; medical management indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by urination at short intervals.

medra_code.Grade 1: Occasional (e.g., with coughing, sneezing, etc.), pads not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Spontaneous; pads indicated; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Intervention indicated (e.g., clamp, collagen injections); operative intervention indicated; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by inability to control the flow of urine from the bladder.

medra_code.Grade 1: Urinary, suprapubic or intermittent catheter placement not indicated; able to void with some residual
medra_code.Grade 2: Placement of urinary, suprapubic or intermittent catheter placement indicated; medication indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Elective invasive intervention indicated; substantial loss of affected kidney function or mass
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; organ failure; urgent operative intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by accumulation of urine within the bladder because of the inability to urinate.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic but no hydronephrosis, sepsis, or renal dysfunction; urethral dilation, urinary or suprapubic catheter indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Altered organ function (e.g., hydronephrosis or renal dysfunction); invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by blockage of the normal flow of contents of the urinary tract.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the urinary tract.

medra_code.Grade 1: Present
medra_code.Grade 2: Limiting instrumental ADL; medical management indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sudden compelling urge to urinate.

medra_code.Grade 1: Present
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a change in the color of the urine.

medra_code.Grade 2: Present
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the abnormal absence of menses for at least three consecutive menstrual cycles

medra_code.Grade 2: Absence of sperm in ejaculate
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by laboratory test results that indicate complete absence of spermatozoa in the semen.

medra_code.Grade 1: Minimal asymmetry; minimal atrophy
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate asymmetry; moderate atrophy
medra_code.Grade 3: Asymmetry >1/3 of breast volume; severe atrophy
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by underdevelopment of the breast.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the breast region.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by abnormally painful abdominal cramps during menses.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild discomfort or pain associated with vaginal penetration; discomfort relieved with use of vaginal lubricants or estrogen
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate discomfort or pain associated with vaginal penetration; discomfort or pain partially relieved with use of vaginal lubricants or estrogen
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe discomfort or pain associated with vaginal penetration; discomfort or pain unrelieved by vaginal lubricants or estrogen
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by painful or difficult coitus.

medra_code.Grade 1: Diminished ejaculation
medra_code.Grade 2: Anejaculation or retrograde ejaculation
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by problems related to ejaculation. This category includes premature, delayed, retrograde and painful ejaculation.

medra_code.Grade 1: Decrease in erectile function (frequency or rigidity of erections) but intervention not indicated (e.g., medication or use of mechanical device, penile pump)
medra_code.Grade 2: Decrease in erectile function (frequency/rigidity of erections), erectile intervention indicated, (e.g., medication or mechanical devices such as penile pump)
medra_code.Grade 3: Decrease in erectile function (frequency/rigidity of erections) but erectile intervention not helpful (e.g., medication or mechanical devices such as penile pump); placement of a permanent penile prosthesis indicated (not previously present)
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the persistent or recurrent inability to achieve or to maintain an erection during sexual activity.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; elective intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by blockage of the normal flow of the contents in the fallopian tube.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the development of secondary female sex characteristics in males due to extrinsic factors.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild swelling or obscuration of anatomic architecture on close inspection
medra_code.Grade 2: Readily apparent obscuration of anatomic architecture; obliteration of skin folds; readily apparent deviation from normal anatomic contour
medra_code.Grade 3: Lymphorrhea; gross deviation from normal anatomic contour; limiting self care ADL

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic (e.g., pain or psychosocial impact)
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; elective operative intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by excessive development of the breasts in males.

medra_code.Grade 1: Minimal bleeding identified on imaging study or laparoscopy; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate bleeding; medical intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Transfusion indicated; invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 4: Life-threatening consequences; urgent operative intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by the presence of blood in a fallopian tube.

medra_code.Grade 1: Intermittent/irregular menses for no more than 3 consecutive menstrual cycles
medra_code.Grade 2: Intermittent/irregular menses for more than 3 consecutive menstrual cycles
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a change in cycle or duration of menses from baseline.
medra_code.Navigational Note: Also consider Reproductive system and breast disorders: Premature menopause, Amenorrhea.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild changes in lactation, not significantly affecting production or expression of breast milk
medra_code.Grade 2: Changes in lactation, significantly affecting breast production or expression of breast milk
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by disturbances of milk secretion. It is not necessarily related to pregnancy that is observed in females and can be observed in males.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild; iron supplements indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; medical intervention indicated (e.g., hormones)
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe; transfusion indicated; operative intervention indicated (e.g., hysterectomy)

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; asymmetry with slight retraction and/or thickening of the nipple areolar complex
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; asymmetry of nipple areolar complex with moderate retraction and/or thickening of the nipple areolar complex

medra_code.Grade 1: Sperm concentration > 0 to < 15 million/ml

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Transfusion indicated; invasive intervention indicated; hospitalization
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the ovary.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic and intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Transfusion; invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by tearing or disruption of the ovarian tissue.

medra_code.Grade 2: Present
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in one side of the abdomen between menstrual cycles, around the time of the discharge of the ovum from the ovarian follicle.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic, not interfering with bladder, bowel, or vaginal function; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a reduction in the strength of the muscles of the pelvic floor.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the pelvis.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the penis.

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild pain
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate pain; limiting instrumental ADL
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe pain; limiting self care ADL
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by a sensation of marked discomfort in the area between the genital organs and the anus.

medra_code.Grade 2: Present
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by premature ovarian failure. Symptoms may include hot flashes, night sweats, mood swings, and a decrease in sex drive. Laboratory findings include elevated luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH.)

medra_code.Grade 1: Mild symptoms; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Moderate symptoms; intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Transfusion indicated; invasive intervention indicated; hospitalization
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by bleeding from the prostate gland.

medra_code.Grade 1: Asymptomatic; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated
medra_code.Grade 2: Symptomatic; elective intervention indicated
medra_code.Grade 3: Severe symptoms; invasive intervention indicated
medra_code.Definition: A disorder characterized by compression of the urethra secondary to enlargement of the prostate gland. This results in voiding difficulties (straining to void, slow urine stream, and incomplete emptying of the bladder).
